segfault_guidelines.system: This document serves as an expert guide for analyzing and fixing segmentation faults in Python applications, with a specific focus on concurrent operations, resource management, and thread safety in the context of LangChain and LangGraph applications.
segfault_guidelines.context: The democracy-exe project experiences segmentation faults during concurrent operations, particularly in LangSmith client background threads and LangGraph SSE handling. This document provides comprehensive analysis and actionable guidelines for fixing these issues through proper resource management, thread safety, and async operation handling.
segfault_guidelines.instructions: 1. Follow the diagnostic points to identify similar issues in your code 2. Implement the recommended fixes based on priority 3. Use the provided code patterns as templates for implementation 4. Add appropriate tests based on the testing recommendations 5. Ensure all implementations follow the style preferences

pattern.name: SafeFileHandler
pattern.description: Pattern for safe file operations with proper cleanup
pattern.example: async with SafeFileHandler(path, mode="r") as f: content = await f.read()

pattern.name: ThreadPoolExecutor
pattern.description: Pattern for proper thread pool management
pattern.example: with ThreadPoolExecutor() as pool: try: result = await loop.run_in_executor(pool, func) finally: pool.shutdown(wait=True)

pattern.name: AsyncContextManager
pattern.description: Pattern for proper async resource management
pattern.example: async def __aexit__(self, exc_type, exc_val, exc_tb): try: await self.cleanup() finally: await self.close()

pattern.name: EventLoopSafety
pattern.description: Pattern for safe event loop operations
pattern.example: async def io_operation(): return await loop.run_in_executor(None, blocking_io_func)

pattern.name: ThreadSynchronization
pattern.example: self._lock = asyncio.Lock() async with self._lock: await self._perform_operation()

pattern.name: ResourceCleanup
pattern.example: async def cleanup(self): async with self._cleanup_lock: try: await self._cleanup_resources() finally: self._closed = True
